comment: I took this as an online summer class. There were a lot of required movies and lectures, but Professor Levy was the most understanding and helpful. I made this account just to rate his class! He is a lenient grader as long as you do the work. Easy A

This was the easiest A I've ever earned in college. Dr. Levy was funny and class was very enjoyable. But don't expect to learn much about screenwriting. I've studied this art form for at least a decade and Dr. Levy didn't teach us much about it. But if you want a fun class for an easy grade this is it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Levy is a very funny guy, but a bit disorganized. He takes a while to grade stuff which can be worrisome. I like him as a person, and he did make class fun, but some of the stuff took up a lot of time. Go to class or you will not pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He is a great and funny teacher. You can tell by the assignments that he didn't want to stifle a student's creativity; however, this posed a challenge because he would never give back our papers. All grades were posted online, so you never had an idea of the exact mistakes you made. However, as long as you came to class and did the work, you were o

Super easy A. Literally just do all the discussion posts and written scenes when he asks you to and you'll do fine. It doesn't matter if what you write sucks, he just wants to see that you do it. Most of the time he makes you turn in assignments and have that count as attendance so come to at least every second half of the class and you'll pass.

Dr. Levy helped me find my career niche. I always knew I wanted to be a writer, but by taking his playwriting class, I've confirmed that this is my destined direction. This has been the class of a lifetime.

Mandatory Attendance affects Grade. LOTS OF DISCUSSION POSTS LOTS OF READING. Dr. Levy is a talented writer and teacher. He has a dream of the kind of teacher he wants you to be. So prepared. Can be vague at times when it comes to MGP assignment. He's the only teacher who teaches this class at KSU so if you're a Eng Ed major GET READY

How can you not like Dr. Levy?  He's hilarious, always cracking jokes to liven the mood but also to help us better understand the "real world" of teaching high school we were about to enter into. He does have a decidedly social-expressivist pedagogy, so there's an emphasis on sharing personal writing. But I learned a ton from him--and you will too.

Obviously the people who are complaining about his syllabus & grading system didn't pay attention. Although Leevy's teaching techniques are different than other professors, he teaches the power of writing & how writing from the heart cannot have a letter grade. I grew so much as a person & future teacher from this class. He's the best I've had.

I LOVED THIS CLASS!!! Levy was great and my fellow students rocked! Lots of class discussion and real world experience. Great and useful assignments. Levy is a little awkward but knows his stuff. I highly recommend!

Hard to explain, not too approachable, but class was interesting and engaging.  Learned a great deal.    Syllabus not followed. Make sure you attend and do assignments and postings on vista as instructed.  You will be in limbo about your grade till the very end, but if you do your readings and partake in class discussions and you should be fine.

Literally the best college class I've ever taken. Levy is a really good dude. Very intelligent, clever, and witty. I learned a great deal, and for once I can visualize myself as a future educator. Our class quickly became a tightly knit community. I was very sad the class had to end!

You know, I am always on the fence about this guy. I like him personally a lot, but you can NOT miss class no matter the excuse and you have no idea of your grade until the end~which is scary. Class flies by and is entertaining but you have to do online discussions which I have no time for.

One of the best writing teachers I have ever had. Very imaginative writer in his own right. Incredible writer, actually. If you get a chance to hear him read a play or other text, do it. He is an incredible talent.

A hoot!! He has quite a wry sense of humor, and his assignments are so much more interesting than your typical 5-paragraph essay. If you feel like you have been held back by generic english courses throughout your education, this is the class for you! He won't hold you back, and you can really grow as a writer! :)

I can't speak for everyone else, but I highly enjoyed Levy's class. He does come off as a bit unapproachable, but I think that is his persona. As the semester progressed, he was more than willing to meet with me one on one with any questions/concerns I had. My advice would be to keep an open mind and make sure to do the WebCT postings! GOOD LUCK!!
Very disorganized and not that helpful. The activities are fun, but if you have a problem expect it to hang around for a while...

Absolutely useless. Always late, never prepared, no use of technology other than webCT, basically had no syllabus, no explanation of requirements, didn't grade anything, no idea how you're doing until the last week of the semester, most of the readings were written by him, and lord help you if you disagree with him...

After reading all the positive reviews here, I was extremely disappointed with this class. It felt like a waste of time the entire semester. Accomplished next to nothing, syllabus was a joke, requirements for class not made clear at all. Definitely felt like he had favorites. Used the expensive textbook maybe twice. I wouldn't advise taking him.

Extremely disorganized, perpetually late and incredibly unclear about his expectations or even what assignments he expects.  Doesn't stick to the syllabus but then tells you to reference it if you have a question about the class.  Overall, completely unhelpful.  I felt like I wasted my time in a class I was initially excited about.

Very invested in students writing from the heart. Teaches concepts by having you DO them. Reading is relevant, writing creatively is highly valued. Does not make expectations clear but his purpose is to see what you will do with the assignment, not to box you in. Good guy.

Loved his class. Great guy and really knows alot about teaching writing. The feather circles seem odd at first, but turn out to be really great. Come to every class and offer your opinions. Make sure you do the webCT postings.

This man absolutely does not care about anyone but himself. If you're a student who is kind of indiferent to the subject matter, you'll probably enjoy his class, but if you're really passionate about it, he will frustrate you to no end. I really don't understand why he's teaching education classes when he doesn't care about his students at all.
Great Professor.  The class starts off with a bang and continues on from there.
If you need an easy A take this class. The only reason I got a B is because i didn't participate in the WebCt discussions. Assignments were fun. Funny guy, laid back. I will try to take him again!

Funny, bright and a bit strange.  Expects you to think!  Right and wrong don't matter as much as offering your opinions and insights.  Had some awesome class discussions.  Lots of reading and writing, but end results is accomplishment.  I'd take him again if I get the chance.

I think Dr. Levy cares about his students. But sometimes he came across as a little "abrasive." I also felt that he has "favorites" in his classes. But, overall, if you make a real effort in his class, he will reward you with a good grade. I would take another of his classes.

Dr. Levy is a teacher who gives a damn whether you learn or not.  He inspired my class to write from the heart, made me want to be a teacher even more, and has an incredible, dry sense of humor.  Great man and a great teacher
Very nice man.  Genuine, heartfelt.  A little cocky, though.

He is not your run of the mill English teacher.  Very interesting class.  He made English fun and we never had to write a 10 page paper on horses, earthquakes or anything boring like that. He challenged me to be creative. (His "feather circles" at first feel hokey but they end up not being too bad).

This man has A.D.D.  He is very scatterbrained and  is very boring.  He rambles in class about nothing and then expects a project by the next class.He is very unorganized.  Good point.. he is open to discussion and does the work with you.  Do not take him EVER unless you are only taking one class.

This guy is an outstanding teacher.  His papers are somewhat unorthodox, but he is always willing to help. You have to do the work he assigns, because it is part of your grade, but it is easy.  Take him as many times as possible.
